title.narrative: Humanitarian Action Plan: Response and Recovery following Chile floods (25.03.2015)

description.narrative:
This project aims to contribute to the overall recovery of families and communities in the municipality of Taltal in the Antofagasta region as well as in the Atacama region after they were affected by the impact of unprecedented rainfall and severe floods on 25 March 2015. The Atacama desert is known as the most arid desert area in the world, hence the levels of preparedness for such a crisis were low.
The project will achieve its aims through:
- Food Aid: identification of families at need; establishment of a logistics system for collecting, storing and distributing humanitarian supplies in Santiago and the affected areas; distribution of food kits. - Water, Sanitation and Hygiene: distribution of bottled drinking water and water containers; distribution of personal hygiene kits; hygiene promotion programme. - Rehabilitation of Housing and Non-Food Items: minor housing repairs; distribution of kitchen sets, household equipment, household cleaning kits, tool kits and bins; distribution of undergarments and kits for ocular, respiratory and dermatological safety. - Livelihoods: recovery and development of means of family and cooperative subsistence in the affected populations, through support with supplies, and training in entrepreneurial skills, basic management and marketing. - Spiritual and Psychological Support and Community Organisation: development of a comprehensive support programme of psycho-spiritual accompaniment and socio-education for children and adolescents.
An initial estimate is that the project will work with 1,000 families/approximately 4,000 people. Priority is given to families with children, elderly, chronically ill, people with special needs and single-parent households (female-headed).
